docs.snippet: LEAD: Pope John Paul II bluntly labeled the Chilean Government of President Augusto Pinochet ''dictatorial'' today and insisted that the Roman Catholic Church must struggle to bring democracy to Chile.

headline.main: POPE, ON LATIN TRIP, ATTACKS PINOCHET REGIME

byline.original: By ROBERTO SURO, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: President Augusto Pinochet welcomed Pope John Paul II to his politically troubled country today, saying his military Government has sought stability in the face of ''the most extreme materialistic and atheistic ideology ever known to man.''

headline.main: PINOCHET ASSURES POPE HE IS SEEKING STABILITY

headline.main: On Argentine Swing, Pope Plays Many Parts

docs.snippet: LEAD: TENNIS  Mecir Advances: Miloslav Mecir of Czechoslovakia, playing his first match 24 hours after his arrival in Tokyo, trounced Tsuyoshi Fukui, Japan's No. 1 player, 7-5, 6-1 yesterday to advance to the third round of the $605,000 Japan Open...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: TENNIS Mecir Advances: Miloslav Mecir of Czechoslovakia, playing his first match 24 hours after his arrival in Tokyo, trounced Tsuyoshi Fukui, Japan's No. 1 player, 7-5, 6-1 yesterday to advance to the third round of the $605,000 Japan Open tournament. In another men's match, Ramesh Krishnan of India, seeded 11th, defeated Ben Testerman, 6-3, 4-6, 6-4.

docs.snippet: LEAD: IN the renewed debate over human-rights violations that has come with the Army rebellions of recent days, some Argentines are talking about the excesses that the military committed during the mid-1970s, recalling court testimony of the bestial...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: IN the renewed debate over human-rights violations that has come with the Army rebellions of recent days, some Argentines are talking about the excesses that the military committed during the mid-1970s, recalling court testimony of the bestial molestation of women and the torture of men.

headline.main: ARGENTINA SEEKS JUSTICE FOR PAST WITHOUT LOSING IT'S FUTURE
